title: What Is the Meaning of a White Dove?

steps.title: Purity & innocence
steps.content: Purity & innocence Due to their pristine white feathers, white doves have long been associated with innocence. They represent spiritual purity and the ability to remain untainted by the world’s negativity. [1] X Research source White doves can serve as reminders to embrace your innocent, youthful side and maintain a pure heart.

steps.title: Peace, hope, & new beginnings
steps.content: Peace, hope, & new beginnings This may date all the way back to the biblical story of Noah’s ark. After the flood, it is believed that Noah sent a dove out from the ark to see if the waters had receded. The dove returned with an olive leaf in its beak, confirming that the flood had ended. [2] X Research source In this story, the dove represents the return of peace after darkness, as well as hope for a fresh start. Olive branches themselves are also symbols of peace, which further reinforces the meaning of the story. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Love & faithfulness
steps.content: Love & faithfulness Because doves mate for life, they are often seen as symbols of fidelity, monogamy, and enduring love. [4] X Research source They’re often released at weddings to represent everlasting partnership and blessings for the newlyweds. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Prosperity & good luck
steps.content: Prosperity & good luck White doves are often seen as signs of impending success. They serve as positive omens of incoming financial stability and victory in professional endeavors. [6] X Research source More generally, they can also symbolize good luck and blessings in any area of your life where you need it. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Divine connection & spirituality
steps.content: Divine connection & spirituality White doves are often seen as messengers between the physical and the spiritual realms, and they therefore symbolize a connection to the divine. [8] X Research source This may be due to the fact that white dove feathers closely resemble the white feathers of angels’ wings.

steps.title: In the U.S., white doves are often released at weddings and funerals.
steps.content: In the U.S., white doves are often released at weddings and funerals. At weddings, doves are released to represent everlasting love and faithfulness. At funerals, dove releases symbolically represent letting go of your departed loved one, so they can rest and be at peace. [9] X Research source

steps.title: In Chinese culture, doves represent fidelity and eternal love.
steps.content: In Chinese culture, doves represent fidelity and eternal love. This is likely due to the fact that doves form lifelong partnerships with their mates. [10] X Research source They also symbolize longevity and the ability to live a long, healthy life.

steps.title: In Christianity, white doves are associated with God and the Holy Spirit.
steps.content: In Christianity, white doves are associated with God and the Holy Spirit. In the Bible, God uses white doves to communicate His presence and faithfulness to followers. The Holy Spirit also descends in the form of a dove after Jesus’s baptism in the New Testament. [11] X Research source

steps.title: In Buddhism, doves symbolize peace and purity.
steps.content: In Buddhism, doves symbolize peace and purity. Doves are often depicted near the Buddha in Buddhist art, representing compassion, kindness, and enlightenment. They’re also seen as signs of spiritual awakening . [12] X Research source

steps.title: In ancient Greece and Rome, white doves were associated with love.
steps.content: In ancient Greece and Rome, white doves were associated with love. Known as Aphrodite in Greece and Venus in Rome, the goddess of love was often depicted with doves surrounding her. As such, doves came to symbolize romantic love and fertility. [13] X Research source Doves were also said to carry ambrosia, the favored drink of gods and goddesses, to Mount Olympus. [14] X Research source

steps.title: In ancient Celtic culture, doves were considered spiritual messengers.
steps.content: In ancient Celtic culture, doves were considered spiritual messengers. Doves were seen as oracles, so their behaviors were often studied for insight into the future from the spiritual realm. [15] X Research source They were also used in healing rituals. [16] X Research source

steps.title: If a white dove visits you, it may be a sign of hope and new beginnings.
steps.content: If a white dove visits you, it may be a sign of hope and new beginnings. Doves symbolize renewal and newfound optimism after a period of darkness. If you spot a white dove while you’re going through a difficult time , this is a powerful, positive omen. Beautiful new beginnings and rejuvenation are coming your way, so hang in there! [17] X Research source What to do: Prepare yourself for a fresh start . Start trying out new hobbies, exploring new interests, or setting new goals to make use of the renewing energy that’s coming to you. [18] X Research source This also means letting go of things that are no longer serving you in order to make room for positive change. This can be scary at first, but it’s also totally worth it in the long run!

steps.title: White doves can be signs of angelic protection and guidance.
steps.content: White doves can be signs of angelic protection and guidance. Due to the resemblance between white dove feathers and the feathers on angels’ wings, a dove visitation may be a sign from your guardian angels. If you encounter a white dove, your angels may be letting you know that they are near, and that you’re on the right path. [19] X Research source What to do: Work on developing and following your intuition . The universe may be trying to communicate with you, and sharpening your intuitive powers will help you recognize its messages!

steps.title: Seeing a white dove may be a reminder to be mindful and aware.
steps.content: Seeing a white dove may be a reminder to be mindful and aware. If your life has been full of chaotic energy lately, a white dove sighting may be a message from the universe to pause and take a deep breath. White doves are often seen as reminders to focus on the present, increase your awareness, and live mindfully. [20] X Research source What to do: Try out mindfulness techniques such as meditation or yoga to get more in-tune with your surroundings and your spiritual side. Mindfulness can also reduce stress, anxiety, and depression levels, boost your immune system, and improve sleep quality, so it's a beneficial practice to incorporate into your daily life! [21] X Trustworthy Source Greater Good Magazine Journal published by UC Berkeley's Greater Good Science Center, which uses scientific research to promote happier living Go to source

steps.title: A visitation from a white dove symbolizes comfort in times of grief.
steps.content: A visitation from a white dove symbolizes comfort in times of grief. If you see a white dove while you’re dealing with the loss of a loved one , it may be a message of comfort from them to let you know they are at peace. [22] X Research source What to do: Be kind and patient with yourself as you mourn. Allow yourself to feel all of your emotions, and don’t try to rush the grieving process. Healing takes time, but you will feel better eventually! [23] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source

steps.title: Dreams of white doves are usually positive omens.
steps.content: Dreams of white doves are usually positive omens. Depending on the type of dream you have, the dove may symbolize freedom, love, spiritual guidance, or peace. Here are some more details: Dreaming of a white dove soaring through the sky indicates freedom and success. Release from an emotional or financial burden may come soon. [24] X Research source If you dream of a white dove perched on a branch, you may be afraid to take a leap of faith in a situation. The dream might be a sign to let go of your fears and go for it! [25] X Research source A dream of a white dove sitting on your arm represents peace and reconciliation. If you’re in an argument with someone, it may be time to mend the relationship. [26] X Research source If you dream of many white doves, this is usually a sign that you’re on the right path. Keep moving forward—good luck, prosperity, and inner peace are coming your way! [27] X Research source
